H0.text: Shape and physical state are the two properties of a crayon that remain about the same after the crayon is melted.

H1.text: Temperature and hardness are the two properties of a crayon that stay about the same after the crayon is melted.

H2.text: Color and mass are the two properties of a crayon that stay about the same after the crayon is melted.

H3.text: Thickness and texture are the two properties of a crayon that will remain about the same after the crayon is melted.

A4.text: Melting, or fusion, is a physical process that results in the phase transition of a substance from a solid to a liquid.

A5.text: Its temperature remains constant as the system is supplied with latent heat during a phase change.
